info.title: MarzbanAPI
info.description: Unified GUI Censorship Resistant Solution Powered by Xray

post.description: Authenticate an admin and issue a token.

get.description: Retrieve the current authenticated admin.

post.description: Create a new admin if the current admin has sudo privileges.

403.description: You're not allowed to edit another sudoer's account. Use marzban-cli instead.

delete.description: Remove an admin from the database.

403.description: You're not allowed to delete sudo accounts. Use marzban-cli instead.

get.description: Fetch a list of admins with optional filters for pagination and username.

schema.title: Response Get Admins Api Admins Get

get.description: Retrieve core statistics such as version and uptime.

post.description: Restart the core and all connected nodes.

get.description: Get the current core configuration.

schema.title: Response Get Core Config Api Core Config Get

put.description: Modify the core configuration and restart the core.

schema.title: Response Modify Core Config Api Core Config Put

get.description: Retrieve the current node settings, including TLS certificate.

post.description: Add a new node to the database and optionally add it as a host.

get.description: Retrieve details of a specific node by its ID.

put.description: Update a node's details. Only accessible to sudo admins.

delete.description: Delete a node and remove it from xray in the background.

get.description: Retrieve a list of all nodes. Accessible only to sudo admins.

schema.title: Response Get Nodes Api Nodes Get

post.description: Trigger a reconnection for the specified node. Only accessible to sudo admins.

get.description: Retrieve usage statistics for nodes within a specified date range.

400.description: Start date must be before end date

get.description: Provides a subscription link based on the user agent (Clash, V2Ray, etc.).
Retrieves detailed information about the user's subscription.
Fetches the usage statistics for the user within a specified date range.

400.description: Start date must be before end date

get.description: Provides a subscription link based on the specified client type (e.g., Clash, V2Ray).
Fetch system stats including memory, CPU, and user metrics.
Retrieve inbound configurations grouped by protocol.

schema.title: Response Get Inbounds Api Inbounds Get

get.description: Get a list of proxy hosts grouped by inbound tag.

schema.title: Response Get Hosts Api Hosts Get

put.description: Modify proxy hosts and update the configuration.

schema.title: Response Modify Hosts Api Hosts Put

get.description: Get a list of User Templates with optional pagination

schema.title: Response Get User Templates Api User Template Get

post.description:
Add a new user template

- **name** can be up to 64 characters
- **data_limit** must be in bytes and larger or equal to 0
- **expire_duration** must be in seconds and larger or equat to 0
- **inbounds** dictionary of protocol:inbound_tags, empty means all inbounds

409.description: Template by this name already exists

get.description: Get User Template information with id

put.description:
Modify User Template

- **name** can be up to 64 characters
- **data_limit** must be in bytes and larger or equal to 0
- **expire_duration** must be in seconds and larger or equat to 0
- **inbounds** dictionary of protocol:inbound_tags, empty means all inbounds

409.description: Template by this name already exists

delete.description: Remove a User Template by its ID

post.description:
Add a new user

- **username**: 3 to 32 characters, can include a-z, 0-9, and underscores.
- **status**: User's status, defaults to `active`. Special rules if `on_hold`.
- **expire**: UTC timestamp for account expiration. Use `0` for unlimited.
- **data_limit**: Max data usage in bytes (e.g., `1073741824` for 1GB). `0` means unlimited.
- **data_limit_reset_strategy**: Defines how/if data limit resets. `no_reset` means it never resets.
- **proxies**: Dictionary of protocol settings (e.g., `vmess`, `vless`).
- **inbounds**: Dictionary of protocol tags to specify inbound connections.
- **note**: Optional text field for additional user information or notes.
- **on_hold_timeout**: UTC timestamp when `on_hold` status should start or end.
- **on_hold_expire_duration**: Duration (in seconds) for how long the user should stay in `on_hold` status.

get.description: Get user information

put.description:
Modify an existing user

- **username**: Cannot be changed. Used to identify the user.
- **status**: User's new status. Can be 'active', 'disabled', 'on_hold', 'limited', or 'expired'.
- **expire**: UTC timestamp for new account expiration. Set to `0` for unlimited, `null` for no change.
- **data_limit**: New max data usage in bytes (e.g., `1073741824` for 1GB). Set to `0` for unlimited, `null` for no change.
- **data_limit_reset_strategy**: New strategy for data limit reset. Options include 'daily', 'weekly', 'monthly', or 'no_reset'.
- **proxies**: Dictionary of new protocol settings (e.g., `vmess`, `vless`). Empty dictionary means no change.
- **inbounds**: Dictionary of new protocol tags to specify inbound connections. Empty dictionary means no change.
- **note**: New optional text for additional user information or notes. `null` means no change.
- **on_hold_timeout**: New UTC timestamp for when `on_hold` status should start or end. Only applicable if status is changed to 'on_hold'.
- **on_hold_expire_duration**: New duration (in seconds) for how long the user should stay in `on_hold` status. Only applicable if status is changed to 'on_hold'.

Note: Fields set to `null` or omitted will not be modified.

post.description: Revoke users subscription (Subscription link and proxies)

get.description: Get all users
Get users usage

400.description: Start date must be before end date

get.description: Get all users usage

400.description: Start date must be before end date

put.description: Set a new owner (admin) for a user.

get.description:
Get users who have expired within the specified date range.

- **expired_after** UTC datetime (optional)
- **expired_before** UTC datetime (optional)
- At least one of expired_after or expired_before must be provided for filtering
- If both are omitted, returns all expired users

schema.title: Response Get Expired Users Api Users Expired Get

400.description: Start date must be before end date

delete.description:
Delete users who have expired within the specified date range.

- **expired_after** UTC datetime (optional)
- **expired_before** UTC datetime (optional)
- At least one of expired_after or expired_before must be provided

schema.title: Response Delete Expired Users Api Users Expired Delete

404.description: No expired users found in the specified date range

400.description: Start date must be before end date
